reference: Tuljapurkar, S and R. Lee, (2000) Demographic uncertainty and the United States OASDI fund, in Sharing the Wealth: Demographic Change and Economic Transfers between Generations, in A. Mason. and. G. Tapinos, Eds. Oxford University Press.
Lee, Ronald and Hisashi Yamagata (2003) Sustainable Social Security: What Would It Cost? National Tax Journal, v. 56, n. 1, part 1, pp. 27-43.

Lee, Ronald and Shripad Tuljapurkar (2000) Population Forecasting for Fiscal Planning: Issues and Innovations in Alan Auerbach and Ronald Lee, eds., Demography and Fiscal Policy, Cambridge: Cambridge University Press.
Lee, Ronald and Shripad Tuljapurkar (1998b) Uncertain Demographic Futures and Social Security Finances American Economic Review: Papers and Proceedings (May) pp. 237-241.
Lee, Ronald and Shripad Tuljapurkar (1998a) Stochastic Forecasts for Social Security, in David Wise, ed., Frontiers in the Economics of Aging. Chicago: University of Chicago Press, pp. 393-420.
Congressional Budget Office (2001) Uncertainty in Social Securitys Long-Term Finances: A Stochastic Analysis, a paper posted on the CBO web site, www.cbo.gov; December.
Burdick, Clark and Joyce Manchester (2003) Stochastic Models of the Social Security Trust Funds Research and Statistics Note, posted on the web site of the Office of the Actuary.
